result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan Marie Quade

records.addlTxt: Must reside with grandparents, Bob and Glenda Conn
Do not plan
State's Amended Global Settlement Recommendation
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement - Wellness Court

2:04 PM Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court and in custody.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Marie Quade.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Charles James Simono in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF189 and 22CF44. State - matters are resolved, puts administrative issues on the record, added an OWI 2nd to 21CF179 for stated reasons and wants to make sure the defendant is aware of the Amended Criminal Complaint. Court does that. Defendant and Halyburton are aware of the Amended Complaint adding count #5 and waives formal reading of it; on 21CT179 - plead G to counts #1, #2 and #5 as alleged; on 22CF44 - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged; on count #1 of 21CT179 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, count #2 - DEJ, count #5 - 5 days of incarceration, fine of $1429.00, 12 month DL revocation, IID is left up to the Court as it is a controlled substance case,  reimburse FOSO the amount of $27.75 for blood draw, other probation conditions for count #1 to include: comply with all rules of the Wellness Court Program and successfully complete it and graduate from the Wellness Court Program, maintain absolute sobriety, no consumption or possession of alcohol or THC in any form, no entry into any bars or taverns, if permitted by Wellness Court - maintain/obtain full time employment/school, take all medication as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, take any OTC drugs as directed on the packaging; 22CF44, #1 - court costs, #2 - part of DEJ; puts on the record the results of the drug test for count #5 on 21CT179. Halyburton and Quade agree, states that parties have stipulated to the credit amounts of 58 days on 21CF179 and 72 days on 22CF44. Court has discussion with parties as it relates to the resolution of Wellness Court as defendant was on it once and did not successfully complete it. Court asks about counts #3 and #4 on both cases, are they dismissed or DRI. State and Halyburton -DRI. Court makes sure the defendant knows what it means for a count to be DRI. Quade plead G as alleged to counts #1, #2 and #5 on 21CF179; Quade pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged on 22CF44. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4 on both cases. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty on count #1 on 21CF179 and count #1 on 22CF44, court withholds finding of guilty on count #2 on 21CF179 and count #2 on 22CF44 - accepts DEJ, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Halyburton makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 on 21CF179 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: comply with all rules of the Wellness Court Program and successfully participate and complete it and graduate successfully from the Wellness Court Program and comply with all rules of Treatment Court, maintain absolute sobriety, no consumption or possession of alcohol or THC in any form - even if it is legal in the jurisdiction that she may be in, no entry into any bars or taverns, if permitted by Wellness Court - maintain/obtain full time employment, take all medication as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, take any OTC drugs as directed on the packaging, costs - 60 DTP/CO, credit for 53 days credit only if revoked; count #2 on 21CF179 - DEJ - convert bond to $10,000.00 signature bond; count #5 - 5 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for 5 days, fine of $1429.00 - 60 DTP/CO, reimburse FOSO the amount of $27.75 for blood draw - 60 DTP/CO, 12 month DL revocation; 22CF44 - count #1 - court costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO; count #2 - DEJ - convert bond to $10,000.00 signature bond, credit for 72 days on 22CF44 if revoked on DEJ, submit DNA sample, felony rights given, right to appeal, adjourned,
Wellness Court Eligibility Letter
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Initial Discovery Cover Letter

10:21 AM Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Megan Marie Quade in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Megan Marie Quade appeared by video means with Attorney. State - here for PH but believes it will be waived. Halyburton and Quade agree, has filed the waiver but not signed for stated reasons, has gone over it ver batim and received her permission to sign it electronically. Quade agrees. Court has form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information that does not mirror the complaint. Halyburton respond, at AIA - Court dismissed counts #3 and #4 after a motion was filed and not objected to, will waive the reading of the Information, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for JT.

02:49 PM Defendant Megan Marie Quade in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Megan Marie Quade in custody from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Megan Marie Quade appeared by video means with Attorney. State - here for a motion to dismiss counts #3 and #4 as filed by defense counsel - not contesting the motion. Court grants motion, Halburton to upload order for signature. Halyburton and Quade have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH within time limits. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 3/30/22 at 10:45 PM.
to dismiss counts 3 & 4

10:17 AM Defendant Megan Marie Quade appears by video from FC jail, in custody with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appearing by video. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. CC and CR appear by video. Halyburton has went over complaint with Quade and asks for AIA, drafting motion. Court will allow AIA, scheduled for 3/16/22 at 9:15 AM. Court questions why she is incarcerated. Quade is on a PO hold. Court will continue bond.
